III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
1

limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/18/25, it was overheard that two different staff members
assaulted a youth. The only incident witnessed was the youth
assaulting staff.
Investigation Interviews:
On 06/23/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Chief
Administrator (CA) and Director of Residential Services (DRC)
at Christ Child House (CCH). They were advised of the Special
Investigation and provided the allegations. CA and DRC were
aware of the incident and both denied knowledge that Staff 1 or
Staff 2 were physically aggressive with Youth A. A request was
made for video footage and incident reports.
On 06/26/2025 an in-person interview was held with
Complainant. No additional concerns were noted.
In-person interviews were completed with the following at
CCH on 6/26/2025, unless otherwise noted.
Youth A was interviewed and asked to tell me about what
occurred between him and Staff 1 and Staff 2. He reported he was
up front trying to get into the agency and he was banging on the
windows and doors when Staff 1 grabbed his wrist in an attempt to
get him to stop. Youth A reported he pulled away and ran to the
back of the agency to the Motor City room. He reported he
pushed the Plexi glass out and entered the room through the
window. Youth A reported he was hot and tired of being outside.
He then stated he was back at the entrance of the building and
both Staff 1 and Staff 2 both grabbed his arm, but stated it was a
“fundamental restraint”. Youth A recalled that law enforcement
was eventually called and he went to the hospital for an
evaluation. Youth A denied that other youth or staff were present.
He denied having other instances of physical assault by Staff 1 or
Staff 2. Youth A was asked if he recalls Supervisor 1, Staff 3 or
Clinical Case Manager being present or coming outside and he
reported no. I asked Youth A if he recalled standing in front of or
near the agency vehicle or being upset because he was unable to
go on an outing and he responded no. Youth A continued to
attempt to redirect the interview to other topics and eventually was
2

not focused enough to remain on topic. Youth A ended the
interview by stating that he feels safe at the agency.
Human Resource (HR) Director was interviewed. She reported
she went outside for a break and saw Staff 1 and Staff 2 outside
with Youth A. She witnessed Youth A yelling at staff and then
looked at HR Director and yelled “he assaulted me” while pointing
at Staff 1. HR Director stated Youth A was holding a piece of
plastic in his hand and was charging toward Staff 1. Attempts to
deescalate youth was unsuccessful and Staff 1 called 911. Staff 2
and HR Director placed Youth A in a 2 person CPI restraint which
lasted for about three minutes. When released, Youth A again
started charging toward Staff 1. HR Director reported that she
attempted to encourage youth to consider how his behavior may
jeopardize his visits with his grandmother, but the redirection was
not successful. Youth A then hit Staff 2 and was again placed in a
2 person CPI restraint by Staff 1 and Staff 2. It was reported that
this restraint also lasted about three minutes. Youth A began to
calm down and law enforcement arrived, so Youth A was
released. Law Enforcement began to chat with him and HR
Director reported she went back inside. She denied seeing staff
use inappropriate restraint techniques, twisting the arm of the
youth, or grabbing the youth. She denied that any other youth
were present and denied knowledge of Staff 1 or Staff 2 engaging
in an inappropriate restraint with Youth A or any other youth at the
agency. HR Director assessed Youth A to be the aggressor in this
situation.
Staff 1 was interviewed and advised that he was explaining
program policies and Youth A became upset when he began
talking about restrictions for youth. Staff 1 stated Youth A called
him a “fucking liar” in response to the example he provided. He
reported Youth A then ran outside to the agency vehicle being
driven by Supervisor 1. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 was
preparing to leave with other youth that were going on an outing.
Youth A was leaning against the passenger side door and refusing
to move. Staff 1 stated Youth A was asked to move back on
several occasions and refused. Staff 1 reported he gently moved
the arm of Youth A from the vehicle door and used his body to
create enough space between the Youth and the car and
instructed Supervisor 1 to drive off. Staff 1 reported that Youth A
then began to walk around the campus outside near the parked
cars and both he and Staff 2 were following. Staff 1 reported that
Youth A began yelling and saying “I’m going to kill you” while
holding a piece of broken hard plastic in his hand while walking
toward him. Staff 1 reported this is when he saw HR Director
3

come outside. HR Director and Staff 2 initiated a restraint of
Youth A and Staff 1 stated he called Law Enforcement. After they
let Youth A out of the restraint, he then hit Staff 2 and was again
put into a restraint by Staff 1 and Staff 2. Clinical Case Manager
(CM) came outside and also monitored the environment. Youth A
was released from the restraint and Clinical CM offered him some
water. The police arrived and walked him around the agency
grounds talking with him and decided to transport him to the
hospital. Staff 1 denied that Youth A went near the Motor City
room or that he saw him push a window out. Staff 1 also denied
engaging in any inappropriate physical restraint with Youth A or
twisting his arm. He denied that any other youth were present and
observed the restraints.
Staff 2 was interviewed and he reported that Youth A was
escalated because he was not able to go on outings that day due
to his previous behavior. Staff 2 reported that Youth A went
outside and went to a vehicle occupied by Supervisor 1 and some
other agency youth. Staff 2 could not recall all the youth that were
in the car. Youth A stood next to the car and refused to move and
would not allow Supervisor 1 to leave. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1
gently grabbed the arm of Youth A and placed himself between
Youth A and the vehicle, creating enough space for Supervisor 1
to drive off. Youth A began to yell that Staff 1 assaulted him.
Staff 2 recalled that Youth A ended up walking toward the front of
the building and remained escalated. He was punching at
windows and broke a piece of sharp plastic from one of the
windows and started to come toward Staff 1 and saying “I’m going
to kill you”. Staff 2 reported that at some point HR Director had
came out and was assisting in trying to verbally deescalate Youth
A. Youth A became more upset and began hitting at Staff 1. Staff
2 and HR Director placed Youth A in a restraint and Staff 2 stated
he believed that Staff 1 called the police for assistance. He
reported Youth A remained in the restraint and they released him
as HR Director was losing her grip. Youth A sat on the ground for
a moment and then charged toward Staff 2. Staff 2 recalled that
Clinical Case Manager and Clinical Director also came outside.
He stated that they also attempted to verbally redirect Youth A
without success. Staff 2 reported that Youth A was sitting on the
ground, but then got up and charged toward him and another
restraint was initiated. This time by Staff 2 and Staff 1. He
recalled that the restraint lasted maybe five minutes. Youth A
stated he was tired and requested to sit down and the restraint
was released. Youth A sat down and was given water by the
Clinical Case Manager. Staff 2 reported that the police arrived
and began speaking with Youth A before taking him to the hospital
4

for an evaluation. Staff 2 denied that he twisted the arm of Youth
A, engaged in any type of inappropriate restraint and denied that
any other youth were present.
On 07/08/2025 a video conference was held with Foster Care
Worker of Youth A. She indicated no concerns for Youth A and
his placement at CCH.
In-person interviews were completed with the following at
CCH on 7/17/2025, unless otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with Clinical Director. She reported
coming out the side door because she could hear that a youth was
escalated right outside her window. She came outside and saw
Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2. She denied any other youth were
present. She reported that when she came outside, Youth A was
already in the restraint with HR Director and Staff 2. She reported
the restraint was appropriate. Youth A was let out of the restraint.
He was quiet for a brief moment, but then began to yell that he
was assaulted by the staff while sitting on the ground. Clinical
Director attempted to verbally deescalate the youth without
success. Youth A then got up from the ground and charged
toward Staff 2. A second restraint was initiated by Staff 2 and she
was unable to recall who the second staff was; but believed it to
be Staff 1 or HR Director. Clinical Director reported that once
Youth A calmed down, she went back inside. She denied seeing
Staff 1 or Staff 2 be physically inappropriate with Youth A or
twisting his arm during the restraint.
An interview was completed with Supervisor 1. She recalled that
Youth A was upset because he could not go on an outing. She
stated she was driving the agency vehicle and when she went to
the car with other youth, Youth A came and stood by the
passenger door/window and refused to move. She confirmed that
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were the staff outside that were attempting to
redirect Youth A. She stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 attempted to
redirect Youth A, but he failed to listen. She stated she could not
really see what was going on, but it looked as if Staff 1 put his
arms and body in between Youth A and the car and told her to
slowly back up. She did recall that Youth A was yelling and using
profanity toward the staff. As she was pulling off she stated she
saw Youth A trying to attack Staff 2. Supervisor 1 denied ever
seeing Staff 1 or Staff 2 be physically inappropriate with youth.
She denied seeing either staff twist the arm of Youth A or be
physically aggressive with him. She could not recall the specific
youth that were in the car with her that day.
5

Director of Residential Services was interviewed. She denied
any concerns with Staff 1 and Staff 2. She further confirmed via
agency video footage that Youth C and Youth D were in the
agency vehicle with Supervisor 1 when Youth A refused to move
from the vehicle.
An interview was completed with Clinical Case Manager (CM).
She reported Youth A banged on her window from the outside and
said that he was being abused. CM went outside to see what was
going on. She reported hearing Youth A yelling “they are abusing
me”. It was hot outside, so she went back in to get Youth A and
the staff some water. Upon return, she stated Youth A was
already in a restraint with HR Director and Staff 2. Staff 1 asked
that she wait to give the youth the water. CM reported she then
went to her car to get the gate opener, because she was aware
that the police had been called. CM reported she provided the
gate opener to Staff 1 and then went back inside. CM denied any
other youth were outside and denied seeing or having knowledge
of Staff 1 or Staff 2 being physically inappropriate with Youth A or
other youth at the agency.
An interview was completed with Youth B. He confirmed that he
is familiar with Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2. He denied seeing
Staff 1 and Staff 2 be physically aggressive with any youth at
CCH. He also denied that he has ever been hit, punched or
inappropriately restrained by them.
An interview was completed with Youth C. He denied recalling
Youth A refusing to move from the agency vehicle. Youth C then
stated he maybe remembers a time When Youth A locked the
door and held it down and refused to move from the door. Youth
C stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 were trying to calm Youth A down and
tried to make him move from the car. He did not recall specifically
how the staff was trying to get Youth A to move, but recalled
hearing them keep telling Youth A to move. Youth C does not
recall how Youth A was moved, but stated the agency vehicle
soon was able to leave and they went on the outing. He denied
seeing Staff 1 or Staff 2 twist the arm of Youth A. He also denied
having any concerns with Staff 1 or Staff 2. Lastly, he denied
seeing or having knowledge of the staff engaging in physically
aggressive behavior with youth at the agency.
An interview was completed with Youth D. He could not recall if
he was in the agency vehicle with Supervisor 1 and Youth A stood
by the vehicle and refused to move. He stated the youth do that
6

often. He was unable to provide specific names of youth that he
has seen refuse to move from the vehicle. Youth D confirmed he
is familiar with Staff 1 and Staff 2 and denies seeing or having
knowledge of them being inappropriate physically with youth at the
agency.
Video Footage Review:
Video 1 was reviewed. Video is dated for 6/18/2025 and time
stamped at 11:07am. Supervisor 1 can be seen going to agency
vehicle, along with other youth. Once in the vehicle, Youth A is
seen arriving at the passenger side front door. Staff 1 and Staff 2
are seen in the area. They are speaking with an unidentified staff
who drove off in their car. Staff 1 and Staff 2 then walk over to the
passenger side car of the vehicle where Youth A is. Staff 1 walks
up to the car and removes the arm of Youth A from the vehicle
and steps in between the vehicle and Youth A and then tells
Supervisor 1 to drive off. Supervisor 1 drives off and Youth A runs
to another area of the parking lot where vehicles are parked. Via
audio, Staff 1 and Staff 2 can be heard asking Youth A to step
back from the vehicle. When Staff 1 removes the arm of Youth A
from the vehicle, Youth A is heard yelling “get your god damn
hands off of me. You assaulted me”. Youth A is also heard
saying, “I need to make a phone call. I’m pressing charges, I
wasn’t doing shit wrong, and he just assaulted me”.
Video 2 was reviewed. It is dated for 6/18/2025, time stamped at
11:11 am and labeled as Main Front Door. Due to the location of
the staff and the awning on the building, activity between the staff
and the youth is not visible. There is no audio for this video. Staff
1 is seen walking up to the main front door. At 11:12 am Youth A
comes into the camera frame. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are seen
immediately thereafter. All three then walk back toward the
parking lot of the agency and the awning on the building does not
allow for view of what is occurring. Bottom legs of Youth A, Staff
1, Staff 2 and HR Director is seen in the video footage.
Video 3 was reviewed. It is dated for 6/18/2025, time stamped for
11:11 am and is labeled parking lot. There is distance in the view
of the video, so it is challenging to clearly see and identify all
actions. Nothing is seen in the video footage initially. At about
2:00 minutes into the video, Staff 1 can be seen standing alone
looking toward the main door of the agency. HR Director and
Staff 2 are seen in the video frame about one minute later. Youth
A is then seen running up and hitting and pushing at Staff 1.
There is no response from staff initially. HR Director is seen
7

walking off and then Youth A goes to the other side of the parking
lot and is followed by Staff 1 and Staff 2. The video footage ends.
Documents Reviewed:
Christ Child House Discipline & Behavior Management Policy –
Prohibited Procedures: To ensure that residents rights are
protected, and that service is provided in a manner consistent with
best practice standards outlined below, behavior support
guidelines established by Christ Child House specifically prohibit
the use of restrictive or otherwise unacceptable actions by staff
members included, but not limited to the following criteria
examples:
-Corporal punishment of residence by staff
-Fear eliciting/aversive or any other restrictive/intrusive
consequences
-Physical abuse or verbal abuse of residents by staff
Incident Report
Incident Report # 215030268 dated 6/18/2025. Written by
Director of Residential Services. IR documented the escalated
behavior of Youth A and the need to initiate a restraint due to his
attack on staff with plastic weapon.
CCH Employee Behavior and Discipline Reports
On June 5, 2025 Staff 1 received a verbal warning for not advising
his supervisor that he would not be in to work for the day.
Staff 2 does not have any discipline.
Agency Tour:
On 06/26/2025 a tour of the agency, specifically the location of the
restraint was viewed. No areas of concern were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Staff interviewed did not
report staff assaulting the youth and they reported force was not
utilized to move Youth A’s arm off the vehicle
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
